===JQuery UI Progressbar as Wicket behavior example===

*[http://jqueryui.com/demos/progressbar/ Original javascript version can be found here]*

*Prerequisites:* Your wicket application is configured to use JQWicket as described in the [http://code.google.com/p/jqwicket "Quick Start"] guide. Additionaly to the jquery core library you have to add "jquery ui" to the JQWicket's config.

*Description:* This example demonstrates how to integrate JQuery UI Progressbar with the wicket components using JQWicket.

*Java-Code:*
{{{
public class ProgressbarPage extends WebPage {

	private int counter = 0;
 
	public ProgressbarPage() {

		final ProgressbarWebMarkupContainer progressbar = new ProgressbarWebMarkupContainer("progressbar");
		add(progressbar);
                
                // update progressbar every second via ajax
		add(new AbstractAjaxTimerBehavior(Duration.seconds(1)) {
			@Override
			protected void onTimer(AjaxRequestTarget target) {
				progressbar.value(target, counter);
				counter++;
				if (counter > 100)
					counter = 0;
			}
		});
	}
}
}}}

*Html-Template:*
{{{
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN"
	"http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"
	xmlns:wicket="http://wicket.apache.org/" xml:lang="en" lang="en">
<head>
<title>Progressbar example</title>
</head>
<body> 
 <div wicket:id="progressbar" />
</body>
</html>
}}}
